channel.title: Portfolio Website for Alex Vignjevic
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio Website for Alex Vignjevic

item.title: Airbnb data analysis of Cape Town
item.description: Executive Summary This analysis uses Airbnb data to predict the price of an airbnb for two people for 4 nights in Cape Town. First, the data is cleaned and the variables are put into right format. Second, the variables of interest are examined further and informative graphs and tables are provided. Third, the regression model for price prediction is created and examined.

item.title: Mask Acceptance
item.description: NYT mask use Github source for data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data #Source for data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" nyt_mask_survey<-read_csv(url) #nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(here::here("data", "nyt_mask_survey.csv")) nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "0... ## $ never <dbl> 0.053, 0.083, 0.067, 0.020, 0.053, 0.031, 0.102, 0.152, .

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Covid-19 death rate across gender,age, time
item.description: CDC COVID-19 Public Use Data The data used throughout the analysis can be found at the link below: (https://data.cdc.gov/Case-Surveillance/COVID-19-Case-Surveillance-Public-Use-Data/vbim-akqf). # The data is loaded and the direct link can be found below url <- "https://data.cdc.gov/api/views/vbim-akqf/rows.csv?accessType=DOWNLOAD" covid_data <- vroom(url)%>% clean_names() #Inspecting data glimpse(covid_data) ## Rows: 3,662,325 ## Columns: 11 ## $ cdc_report_dt <date> 2020-03-03, 2020-03-03, 2020-04-07, 20... ## $ pos_spec_dt <date> 2020-03-03, 2020-03-03, 2020-03-03, 20... ## $ onset_dt <date> NA, NA, 2020-03-03, NA, 2020-07-28, 20.

item.title: Exploring pay difference between genders in Omega
item.description: Omega Group plc- Pay Discrimination At the board meeting of Omega Group Plc., the issue was raised that women were being discriminated in the company, in the sense that the salaries were not the same for male and female executives. A quick analysis of a sample of 50 employees (of which 24 men and 26 women) revealed that the average salary for men was about 8,700 higher than for women.
